page.title: 13Bent Ley Farm
page.content: Bent Ley Farm is at Meltham Mills and covers 200 acres. It is owned by the Haigh family. They have 150 Friesian cows of which 60 were giving milk when we visited the farm. The cows give a total of 220 gallons of milk a day which is sent to Dickinsons Creamery to be made into yoghurt. Mr. Haigh does not have a milk round. The fields are used to grow grass which is turned into silage. Mr. Haigh breeds pigs which he kills himself to provide pork for a number of butchers' shops that are owned by other members of his family. He also keeps a few sheep, lambs and poultry to supply the shops. Mr. Haigh has 10 people to help him on his farm and has been a farmer for 32 years.
